questions.question_text: Voice of which of the following is likely to have minimum frequency? (a) Baby girl (b) Baby boy (c) A man (d) A woman

In the following statements, tick 'T' against those which are true, and 'F' against those which are false. (a) Sound cannot travel in vacuum. (T/F) (b) The number of oscillations per second of a vibrating object is called its time period. (T/F) (c) If the amplitude of vibration is large, sound is feeble. (T/F) (d) For human ears, the audible range is 20 Hz to 20,000 Hz. (T/F) (e) The lower the frequency of vibration, the higher is the pitch. (T/F) (f) Unwanted or unpleasant sound is termed as music. (T/F) (g) Noise pollution may cause partial hearing impairment. (T/F)
hints: Check relationship between amplitude and loudness

questions.question_text: Fill in the blanks with suitable words. (a) Time taken by an object to complete one oscillation is called __________. (b) Loudness is determined by the __________ of vibration. (c) The unit of frequency is __________ (d) Unwanted sound is called __________. (e) Shrillness of a sound is determined by the __________ of vibration.
A pendulum oscillates 40 times in 4 seconds. Find its time period and frequency.
hints: Time period = Total time / Number of oscillations

questions.question_text: The sound from a mosquito is produced when it vibrates its wings at an average rate of 500 vibrations per second. What is the time period of the vibration?
hints: 500 vibrations per second means frequency = 500 Hz
